links_reviews_title: Fun and flattering, despite the awkward fit
links_reviews_text: Okay, This sweater is a little awkward but I gave it 5 stars because I actually wore this a ton. We were traveling to the Oregon Coast and I wore it on the plane and at the ocean when it was raining. Super cute and fun colors! I’ve also worn it around the house with jeans, out to dinner with leggings and thrown it on with sweats for extra warmth. I ended up loving it but I really had to warm up to it. It’s constructed in two pieces. The top part (the neck to just below the shoulders) is one piece that kind of hugs into your upper arms and has a clear seam-like piece that separates it from the bottom portion of the sweater. It’s like if you imagine putting on one of those fake turtle neck things that people wore under sweaters in the 90s that is really only half a turtleneck...that’s like the top part of the sweater and where that part ends is tight like almost holding your arms down so you can’t really lift your arms overhead without it pulling the whole thing up awkwardly. links_reviews_title: Still don’t know exactly how I feel
links_reviews_text: There was something about this sweater that just wasn’t right for me. I would put it on and then take it off pretty soon after. I may have been a bit allergic to it because I had to always wear a long-sleeved shirt under it and then I would start to feel a little funny and take it off after a couple of hours. I did wear it on a hike and it was warm and I didn’t experience any funny feelings. Perhaps it was because of more ventilation. I received a compliment on it.
Very thick and chunky, just too broad and heavy for me
Really wanted to wear this because it looks so cute, but ended up not wearing it. It was too itchy so I layered a shirt underneath but then felt too bulky.
was so excited about this sweater! however, the neckline did not work for me. it was too wide (not in an oversized way) and itchy. it did not look right. the sleeves were too short and tight
Amazing, colorful sweater! Very warm. A little pilled from being worn previously, which prevented me from purchasing, but such a cute sweater to wear for a month!

Liked this a lot but I think it got a little bulky as it’s been washed. Seemed to be tight around the neck and pulled at the shoulders. Like it was on a hanger. The colors are amazing and it’s such a fun print.

So warm! Wore this around the house because it was so cozy and warm. It's a little over-sized. I had to cuff the sleeves, but loved it! If you're not used to wearing tons of color, it might feel like a lot of pattern, but pairing it with a jacket helped tone it down.
Adorable and extra warm. This year we are experiencing warmer than usual winter temperatures and this was just too warm to be comfortable. Highly recommend for colder climates.

links_reviews_title: Colorful but bunchy in the shoulders
links_reviews_text: I LOOVED this sweater. The only challenge was it was a slight bulky in the shoulder areas ( prob Becuase of All the great colorwork) So it was always riding up and i have to pull it down to lay flat on my shoulders. Other than that LOOOOOVED it

This sweater is easy and fun! The bright colors and gladiator neckline are very flattering. It is the easy answer to jeans in the winter. Honestly, if it were a bit softer material (there is a mild itch) I would be purchasing.
Cute to wear with any bottoms

I wore this out once and got a ton of compliments on it from both my friends and complete strangers! It's really very comfortable and so cute. It's a pretty thick sweater and which was nice when i was outside in the cold winter, but I was sweating at the pregame I went to, so just be mindful of that. My only issue is that it seemed to fit me weird in the shoulders - otherwise a great sweater.

Loved this sweater! Took it with me on a ski trip to Vermont, although I never wore it on the mountain skiing it was a cabin staple and I wore it out to causal dining twice. Very cozy, comfortable and a fun, quirky statement piece.

I loved this sweater! I got so many compliments on it from coworkers and complete strangers. It was super warm and thick which was great for me since I work in an office where it’s always cold. Would definitely recommend wearing a light long sleeve shirt underneath if your skin is a little sensitive to wool.

Super cute sweater but it was very itchy and the neckline was a bit strange. It was warm also so didn't require anything to be worn under and easily threw a jacket on top when outside. Wish the material was better because the look was very cute!
I wanted to love this. Overall, the fit is fine..but the neck puckers a bit. I don’t have wide shoulder by any means but it looks distorted around my neck/shoulders...so didn’t get to wear this piece
This was such a beautiful sweater but it was very very thick and difficult to wear.
Gorgeous sweater, with lovely bright colors, great quality, slightly oversized. It was perfect to wear around the holidays.
Not my favorite piece but still wore it. Got mixed reviews as it’s a little wild on the design.

this sweater is so fun! bright but also a classic shape. i found it ran large (i wore a small) but i like my sweaters a tad oversized, so i wish i wouldn't have sized down. if i were to rent again, i would stick with my standard size medium. it is kind of itchy and there's no way i would pay full price OR the nuuly discounted price, but it's fun for a rental!
Definitely a statement making, winter sweater. Size down as sleeves are over-sized & can be a bit bulky
It was a fun sweater. Funky print. But, it seemed a bit worn.
overall just wayyyyy too big. looks super warm. wish it were more fitted
wore this on christmas and it was a total hit! super bright colors and not as itchy as i imagined it would be.
Even though I live in a cold climate, this sweater is just too much..too many patterns, too heavy, too ill fitting

This is the perfect sweater for rental - it's pretty eye-popping and you can't go anywhere without getting a reaction. I wore it to just about every different place I could, and ended up just putting it on in the house as it was so warm. It's true to size, but there's a yoke around the neck that can get a little tricky if you size up but have a larger bust. Nothing a sports bra didn't fix to help it all lay better.

I loved this sweater and received compliments each time I wore it. The colors and patterns are brilliant and eye-catching. The cut is a bit boxy and that combined with the thicker yarn make for a chunky sweater that isn't slouchy. I tended to wear it with skinny jeans to add structure to the look.

From the photos on nuuly, I can never tell the texture of a garment. Several times I've been bummed when I ordered a sweater and realized it was knit with metallic thread. That said, I was very pleasantly surprised when this arrived and I realized the red pattern is beading. This sweater has a fun retro vibe and works really well with high waisted pants, which are 100% of my pants, so...

To me, this sweater does not look like the photos. When it arrived it looked pretty old and the color is closer to a yellow. I think it's supposed to be a vintage-y type color. Maybe I just didn't know how to style it but I never wore it and had no desire too.
Just a little too big and also looked worn

links_reviews_title: Cute cardigan! Not the most well structured
links_reviews_text: It was not the best fit, but it was cuuute. The garnishing was pretty.

I had high expectations for this cardigan since it's from Pepaloves, but sadly it missed the mark. I'm usually a M/L and went with the Med since reviews said it ran large, but it was still too big. I'd say the med fits like an XL. Also the material and beading just looked cheap to me. I don't think I'd like it for that reason even if it fit properly. It looked very frumpy on me.
Really liked the beading on this but the sizing didn’t work for me with this style. It’s a very oversized fit (more like a 14 or 16 for the large) in a cardigan that would look best fitted.
The beading on this was very pretty and delicate. But the sweater itself is pretty see through so you have to wear something under it. Also, it fit MUCH larger and boxier than I was anticipating.
I think I would have worn this a lot more if it was a bit smaller. I was able to wear it once, but it definitely had the oversized sweater look and I had to roll up the sleeves. Very pretty beading.
I love how this piece looks on the model, but I never figured out a way to style this and wear it out the door. I might borrow it again when the weather gets warmer.

This sweater is reallllly beautiful. The stitching and beading look really well made. Unfortunately, it’s just too long and baggy, even though I got an XS. I tried it on with several outfits but had to give up :(
This sweater is much more oversized than it looks in the photo, I couldn’t make it work
The beading is beautiful, but the sweater runs so oversized that it just wasn't flattering at all.

links_reviews_title: I liked it but a smaller size would've been better
links_reviews_text: It was just too big. The sweater itself is beautiful; I loved the beading.

When I first tried this on I worried it was dowdy or Christmasy or something, but I ended up wearing it repeatedly and really loving it. Perfect buttoned up with jeans for brunch or work or just everyday life.
I liked the beading and it felt special. Fit was a little boxy, but it was a nice holiday outfit-maker.
I really liked this sweater. I wore it buttoned up and French tucked into high rise skinny jeans and open with a black scoop-neck bodysuit under it. Very soft and pretty. Easy to wear.

I ordered my “regular” size which I’m beginning to wonder if is a size too large. These fit great on hips and legs but waist was gapey and they’re trying to fall down. I guess I’ll be investing in a belt.
I love these. They remind me of Johnny Was or something you would see in Sundance. They can be dressed up or down for any season of the year.

links_reviews_title: Lots of Compliments, rise was a little lower than I like
links_reviews_text: Many people gave me compliments on these jeans, but I like them to sit a little higher on my hips than these did!

I love all the details. They aren't kidding when they say "boyfriend jeans". You will need a belt and there is no room for curve in thighs, fine. But the but is smushed and I am not even curvy there. Waist has big gap in back. So just add a real belt and you are fine.

links_reviews_title: Beautiful Jean but runs very big
links_reviews_text: I was so excited to receive this jean. I ordered my normal jean size(even though I was nervous because they are a skinny fit)...but they are huge...I would need 2 sizes down...which normally I would be thrilled with but hated waisting an item with my Nuuly box....I would recommend because they are well made and fun...but beware of fit.
So this is what a quality pair of jeans feels like! Slightly big in the waist.

links_reviews_title: Cute but didn't work for me
links_reviews_text: Really wanted to like these jeans but they ran big for me so it was already an uphill battle. Wore them once then forgot about them for the rest of the month

Although, I did wear these once and they were cute the waistband was really large. They fit everywhere else (granted they were baggy and boyfriend-like), but the waistband was like 10 sizes too big and created a large gap. Could only wear with a shirt that had a long back to cover the gap. BUT they were cute, just don't really know where they got the sizing. Maybe only work for ladies with a rounder derrière.
These were fun, though not for me as much as they were too low waisted. I read the reviews and sized up, then these were too big (I should have ordered my true size 27).
Great length folded or down. The waist fit great first time worn but after 2nd time wearing they bag out a bit. These would be super cute in warmer weather with sandals. Will order again!

These are very cute and really fit and look like a "boyfriend" jean. The stitching detail adds texture. Wore with kitten heel booties and a sweater... lots of compliments. They did run big- wish I'd ordered a size down, but with a cinched belt they were ok.
Loved the embroidery, got so many compliments!
I wore it with a sweater so you couldn't see how big the waist was. The patches are super cute though! They were comfy but yeah, pretty loose
Cute details! Like boyfriend style so fit is like that.
These are almost baggy, but they fit nicely through the hips and thighs -- not TOO baggy. They feel comfy-cozy for winter with a cashmere turtleneck and Laidback London moccasin boots.
Fit is great, details are perfect! Highly recommend! Wearing with Kiernan blouse i also love!
Great look and fit like always with Pilcro!
The waist was a little loose on me (it is a common problem for me) so I wore it with a belt. Problem solved!
These jeans were comfortable and cute.

I love the embroidered jeans trend. These are perfect - the embroidery is neutral so it doesn’t dominate the outfit. The jeans are a perfect fit. The waist is mid-high and the body of the jeans are comfortably slouchy without looking frumpy. I loved them so much I bought them - they were discounted even deeper on the Anthro site.

I have so many Pilcro jeans that I can confidently say the sizing and fabric is very different per season. I would say these are winter Pilcros - the fit is snug, the fabric less stretchy. I would recommend sizing up.
Wore these with black booties, tan suede booties and white sneakers. Comfortable somewhat relaxed fit. Enjoyed trying embroidered jeans.
Love these
These went on like they were already my favorite jeans. I just loved them!

The pants ballooned at my waist and were tight around my calves. It was not flattering. The photo doesn't reflect how shimmery these are. Which isn't a problem, but something to think about if you aren't into that look. The pants were also a tad itchy.

These pants were very confusing. I was excited to try out linen pants for a trip to Palm Springs but these have a weird, prominent metallic thread. Maybe you'd like them if you have a super glam style but I found them pretty ugly. Never wore.

I loved these pants! They look fairly quiet in the photos, but are actually unequivocally gold. I felt like they functioned as a neutral in my wardrobe, and loved wearing them with sweaters in the cold. Plus, they’re loose enough for thermal underwear underneath. Definitely a great cold-weather option (and I loved that they were lined).

I thought these would be kinda beigey/crepey with little metallic accents in the weave. Instead, the gold metallic in the fabric is dominant and makes these feel like a costume. Also, they were too big in the waist and didn't have belt loops. I couldn't figure out how to style these and ended up not wearing.
Classy and elegant. It fit perfectly, I totally recommend it. I wore these trousers with an off-shoulder crop top and sandals and I got nice compliments.

links_reviews_title: No idea they were so bright and a weird fancy fabric.
links_reviews_text: Did not like at all. So ugly :/

These are really cute and fit well, but they are more lightweight than I thought they would be. They didn't work well, as I ordered them in the dead of winter. They also have a lot more shimmer than the photo shows. More of a statement piece.
Cute in the photo, but did not fit well. They are a nice fabric, but the pleats and fit around the waist, hips, and bum is quite puffy and unflattering.

These pants are very cute - they're a nice ivory color with gold shimmery fabric sewn in with the regular pant fabric. Every time I wore it I got several compliments, since the shimmer is very eye-catching. With that said, I felt that the quality was lacking. The material is very thin and the buttons felt flimsy. Also, this is mid-high-waisted, which I usually love, but since the material is so thin, the area directly below the button puffed out and made my lower belly look bulgy. I do have a bit of a pudge from my pregnancy (I am 3 months postpartum), but I do not have this issue with any other high-waisted pants. I just though that these would be a little more structured, but they felt like something I'd get at department store for $20.
Cute but size down.

I really like the idea of these...they in theory look like something my very stylish grandma might have worn. In reality, the material is very cool looking, like an expensive, special piece, but they wrinkle pretty much immediately (and in a weird way because the thread is kind of like tinsel) and the waist area balloons in an unflattering way and pinches my waist uncomfortably. For someone with a trimmer midsection, and styled with something tucked in I think these could be cute, but they weren't great on me.

links_reviews_title: It's not as long as in the model
links_reviews_text: I thought this sweater was going to be a little bit longer however it was actually pretty cute! When I received it we hit a heat wave so it was perfectly fine for that weather!

This sweater is very grandma-y but in a very sweet way. I'm upset that by the time I was able to rent it, it was starting to get hot here in LA so I only got to use it once and it made me sweat - so it's definitely warm and winter-friendly. I will absolutely rent it again next winter if it's still available. Even though it's made of wool, I didn't find it scratchy at all, on the contrary, it is pretty soft.
way too small
Well, its cold where I live but I am DONE with winter. This bridged the gap perfectly for me. I loved it and wore it a lot.
Cute and as seen in the picture, just something about the fabric or cut just felt off. I never wore it.
Love this little sweater! The pattern is really fun and I love that I could wear it with high wasted pants and it still showed off my waist. It's not super warm, so perfect for the spring.
Very comfy nice sweater! Perfect match Coordinating with shirt inside
Pretty sweater, wore once to work

This is exactly what you'd want a weird, granny-chic sweater from that cool vintage store to actually look like. It is so, so cute. I wanted to wear it every day. It's more cropped than the photo lets on -- there is no way you could tuck it into trousers! Looks great with high-waist white jeans.
Really cropped. I got a large expecting it to be short and I could tuck it in the front of high waisted jeans but it was so short. So if you like cropped things, I’d size down for full effect

links_reviews_title: Very pretty, a bit worn looking
links_reviews_text: I dock a star only because it looks like it has been worn a lot. I'm typically a medium but only large was available so I went for it anyway. It fits nice, a little roomy but cropped so still looks fairly put together. The stitching is beautiful. Soft and comfy. Not something I would buy because it's a high price for a statement piece I wouldn't feel like I could wear all the time.
just a good sweater. feminine and easy to throw on a walk outside. wore it maybe 4 times with jeans and leopard booties.

Great everyday sweater, and I even wore it out once with coated black jeans and some patent combat boots. It was more cropped on me than the model, but I do seem to have a slightly longer torso. For getting an XS I'd say it was a bit wider than anticipated (I'm a 30C / 24 waist for reference), but tucking the front into ultra high jeans made a big difference and was the only way I wore it.
Such a cute sweater! Got a lot of compliments everytime I wore it. Fun and patterned without being overwhelming. It is slightly cropped and paired very well with high waisted jeans.

I really wanted to love this sweater, but sadly it was WAY too small and the sleeves only came down my arms 3/4 of the way. It was also itchy and extremely cropped. Overall I still think the sweater is gorgeous, it just didn’t work out for me unfortunately.

I like the floral design of this sweater. As far as fit, it is cropped as well as boxy, so I sized down because I have a short torso and I’m not a fan of a boxy look. I put a tank underneath and was able to wear it to work. It was not itchy at all and I have very sensitive skin. So overall I like the sweater because of the floral design, but fit for me because of the box shape was just okay. I don’t regret getting it, it was good to wear to work for me.

I liked this sweater, it's really pretty and I liked the pattern a lot. I didn't end up wearing it a lot because it's very worn— doesn't look as smooth and nice as the photo. This is fine but I just felt kind of too sloppy in it to wear it to work but it's too nice of a sweater to just sit around in. Overall wasn't thrilled with it.
Wore multiple times and loved it!
Soft, comfy, adorable. A total win.

links_reviews_title: Really pretty - can dress up and down
links_reviews_text: The details on this sweater are beautiful. It's cropped, but I like highwaisted pants, so that worked for me. I wore with a collared shirt underneath, and it looked adorable.

This sweater is super cute! The flower detail is great! It was shorter than I thought it was going to be. I sized up to a medium and I’m glad I did. The sleeves were also on the short side. BUT it paired well with high waisted jeans and dresses because it hit in the right place.
This sweater is so cute and cozy! Glad I could rent it because as cute as it is... I'd never pay $300 for it. A bit more cropped than I anticipated based on the photos.
It has a cropped fit and goes perfectly with high waisted jeans. I had a hard time letting this one go and got many compliments on it.
Adored this sweater and I’m still mourning the loss of having to send it back. It’s not itchy and is just as detailed in person. Definitely cropped so need to pair it high waisted gear!
Sweater was cute enough, more cropped than I expected, but nothing to write home about.

Absolutely loved this sweater. Got lots of compliments, and would be tempted to buy if not for the price. Definitely worth renting! Is slightly cropped, but not too much. As a petite person, it ends right at my waist where my pants start, so no belly showing.
I do not normally gravitate to traditionally "feminine" peices, but the pattern and detail on this sweater are a work of art. I am totally in love with this comfortable crop.
I’m obsessed with this sweater. So cute, comfortable and I received tons of compliments. Will rent again!

This felt a little shrunken to me. I don't know if it was an issue with this particular sweater or if it is meant to be shrunken. I was expecting a bit more slouch. Beyond that, it's the perfect granny chic piece. It's very soft, but also very warm. I only found one opportunity to wear it because I live in Florida, so I had to wait for a 50F day, haha.
Gorgeous sweater so easy to dress up or down.
Love this sweater! It is very cute with high waisted jeans.
Loved the style and the cut - the fabric was warm and cozy, fit was a little boxy. Worked well open of styled like the model.

This sweater is super cute. It was a little tight around my armpits, but still looked great. Unlike the model, I was unable to unbutton this sweater, I don't think the buttons are not supposed to come undone. That's fine though cause it looks amazing buttoned all the way and the little flowers made me feel like I was in Sound of Music
I liked this a lot, felt special. Was sad to see it go but it's just too pricey to buy.
The perfect grandma sweater! Wasn’t itchy, super cute!
I love this sweater and would keep but it's pricey. It's well made and warm. Looks great with high waisted bottoms because it's cropped.

Based on reviews and size availability I went with a small for this (I’m usually a medium or large). It fit! Sleeves were a tiny bit short but everything else fit well. This sweater was soft and warm. Looked good with jeans. I liked the detail of the chunky wooden buttons.
Love this sweater! I wore it several times and such fun colors. Got tons of complements on this one. Cropped so cute with high waisted jeans.
This sweater is so cute and warm, I wore it a ton and received compliments every time. I contemplated buying it but it was just a little out of my price range for a sweater.
Great little cardigan! Perfect type of thing to rent. Color is beautiful and fit really well. Would rent again!

The length and sleeves of this cardigan were shorter on me than what's shown in the photo but I ended up loving the cropped look! You can wear this so many ways... with a bralette, a t-shirt, a turtleneck. Size up if you want a slouchier fit
Comfortable, warm sweater, great with jeans.

links_reviews_title: Chunky knit cute pattern nice fit
links_reviews_text: This sweater is as cute as it is in the picture. It was a little chunkier than I had thought, but great fit, cute pattern/colors and kept me warm.
Such a fun, dreamy sweater. A little worn, but I didn't mind. Quirky but versatile and wearable with a ton of outfits. Would totally buy this if it wasn't so $$$!
Super beautiful craftsmanship, but it ballooned up on the arms and midsection after I wore it for a few minutes. It made me look big.

I was inspired to try this sweater after seeing Little Women in theaters and ladies and gentlemen, it did not fail to meet my expectations. Super cozy, beautiful stitching, with pretty wooden buttons that look good unbuttoned or all the way. Got lots of compliments, too.
Loved the colors and embroidery, but did not like the fit. Too boxy and unfitted with wide sleeves.
I wore It buttoned the whole time and got lots of compliments. I considered Buying it but it was pulling and a little too expensive. Great rental though.

Pretty sweater and super soft. My husband told me I looked like an old lady, but multiple women complimented me while I wore it! The sweater was looking a little worn, and the bottom button pulls a little awkwardly, but overall liked this sweater and was happy to wear it!
Really nice. Lots of complements. Oversized. I got a large bc that is all there was but M would have easily fit.
WOW. Loved this sweater so so much. It's like your grandmother handknit it... in the best way possible! I adored.
Very warm! And honestly so cute. Was really tempted to buy it. It's chunky and good for layering with a base layer underneath if you live in really cold climates like me!

links_reviews_title: Prepare for a lot of compliments
links_reviews_text: I loved wearing this. I felt like my grandma traveled back in time and made chunky knits cool again. very warm thick and quality. I usually wear a Small but got an XS in this and it fit fine:) LOVED this!
Just looked awful on me! Adorable sweater for the right person though not sure who that would be.
Lots of compliments! Warm, cute, but runs large
The medium fit nicely, not too tight, good for layers. Wore it with jeans and really liked the colors.
I love the colors, but I should have sized down. Although if I had, the sleeves probably would have been too short. Much bulkier than in looked on the model.

links_reviews_title: Cute sweater with the right bottom
links_reviews_text: In my opinion, this looked a little juvenile/too sweet unless you paired it with an edgy bottom like leather pants. Good quality sweater.
I love this sweater. It was so beautiful and soft. It was a little big on me I might have sized down for a better fit
such a sweet little cardigan, really nice hand-stitched detailing and wood buttons. color is very flattering too!

Loved the colors, fit and feel of this sweater. It was super cozy, just colorful enough to make for a fun outfit. I styled with cream wide leg jeans, cream overalls and blue jeans. Easy to layer. Just a really rich sweater that felt great to wear!

I wore this to work many times and LOVE the heavy feel of the wool - great quality! I wasn't sure about the flowers, not usually my style, but this was flattering and feminine and a great combination with skinny jeans or short skirts and boots.

I usually wear a 27-28" in jeans, and sized to a 28, but think I could have gone down a size. I'm a 36" hip, 28" waist, and 5'8" and these things were loooong. I wore midsized heels and was worried this would drag on the ground so I only wore it around the house.

links_reviews_title: Great Quality but not for short legged people
links_reviews_text: I loved this jeans truly however even after I put boots on they were still too long.

links_reviews_title: Good, but you need long legs
links_reviews_text: These were great 70's looking bell bottoms, but they are very long. I have a 32" inseam and they were still dragging on the ground. Would work well with some heeled boots, or maybe a pair of roller skates. They looked cute with my roller skates!
Flattering for sure! I’m 5’8 so lengthy was great with heels but these jeans wouldn’t work for shorter ladies. Great stretch
These are my favorite jeans. They look great on. Every time I wear these jeans I know it will be a great day. I wish the other colors were still in stock.
Loved these jeans, great on the butt! I'm also a long 33' inseam and these fit amazing!

links_reviews_title: Love love love; Good for long legs
links_reviews_text: I have a 34” inseam and it’s not often I find standard pants that are long enough. These were and they were such a cute fit. Definitely feel like pants that have been washed and worn several times, but I didn’t mind that much.

these jeans were amazing. thought they’d be too small when i initially put them on but maybe i just ate too much pasta that night! they fit like a glove in the best way for the next 29 days i had them. the flare was the perfect size too. nice, real quality denim. will probably re order and purchase :)

I’m 5’9” and wore an extra 3” tall boot and these fit perfect. I typically wear a 27 waist and the 26 in these were perfect. Very big bell bottom just like the picture. Wore them to a Rolling Stones and Beatles tribute concert. I got a lot of compliments. I wear them randomly and every time get compliments. They still have yet to stretch out... great pant.

I LOVE these jeans. I am 5.10” and wore them with 3-4 Inch boots, and with the three inch shoe, they were just touching on the ground. So, great for the tall people out there. I probably would rent if I were shorter . I usually wear a 29 and they fit fine, but I almost want to try a 28 to see how they fit, as they do give a little, after wearing. I received compliments every single time I wore these jeans. I will rent my again, and probably buy them.

These jeans were the perfect length for me, a 5'10" gal, to wear them with 2-3" inch booties. I'm normally a 28 but sized down to a 27 b/c of the reviews and at first they were difficult to zip up but they loosened throughout the day and I ended up making the right choice by sizing down

links_reviews_title: Wish i had ordered a size up
links_reviews_text: One size bigger and these would’ve fit so good, BUT, they were easily more than a foot too long. Thought about temporarily hemming them but I really shouldn’t have to go through the trouble of doing so.

links_reviews_title: The longest jeans I've ever tried on!
links_reviews_text: I wanted to love these. The jean material was so nice, and they fit me like a glove... but they are INSANELY long. I regret not reading reviews. I am 5'9", and I would have to wear my tallest heels to even remotely make these work without dragging on the floor. There was seriously a solid 4 extra inches on these babies. Such a shame because they really were cute on.

Love these pants. They are WAY long - so I had to buy them so I could alter them to fit my 5'4" body. Super cute everywhere. Maybe they run a little big because I'm usually not a 26 - more like a 27/28. Awesome 70s vibe and really great fit.
I loved these but couldn't wear them because the pant legs were too long. I tried them with my tallest heels and I still felt like there was just too much fabric.
Not at all flattering on a 5'6" 135 lb frame

I love love love these jeans. They are very flattering and have a nice 70’s vibe. I was nervous that they would be too long due to other reviews. I wore these with a bootie that has maybe a two inch heel and the length was perfect. I am between a size 26 and 25 depending on the brand and went with a 25 which ended up being perfect. If you are on the taller side and have long legs I would absolutely recommend renting these.

I loved these jeans ! The hugged my curves in all The right places and the were nice and long . Being 5’9” it’s hard to find glare that are long enough to wear with heels. I wore a 2 “ heel and they were perfect !

links_reviews_title: Super fun but wouldn't wear outside of the house
links_reviews_text: The first time I wore these my kids were in awe! They were great for staying at home during quarantine, but they were not a flattering fit. I loved them for this season in life for comfort and fun, but I wouldn't rent them again.

I originally ordered these in a small and they were too big. The XS was perfect though! Helped me to feel less slouchy during lockdown, while still being comfortable. Heavier than I was expecting but not bad.
Bright sparkling pants. With tons of sequins. A little heavy but got a lot of compliments
I liked these for quarantine. They’re fun. They aren’t scratchy. I just think they go with very few tops. I wouldn’t wear it out of the house, but luckily this month I was home all month.
These were cute and cozy and perfect for jazzing up quarantine while staying comfortable. Nicely lined and very warm.
I wanted to love these, but they bunched up and had material in all of the wrong places.

links_reviews_title: I was going to wear these to "Dear, Evan Hansen," but Covid-19, so they were #WFH
links_reviews_text: It was delightful to wear these for a Zoom appointment, and I will confirm for everyone working from home, that sequins will make or break your day. These were great. In some future world, maybe I will get to wear these the next time Broadway comes to town. These were loose and great, I could perhaps have gone with an XS, for more of a high waist thing.

When my Vegas plans changed due to the world crisis right now, I paired these pants with the sequined top and wore it as my work from home fit #wfhfit Received many compliments from my coworkers on zoom.
LOVED THESE SO MUCH! everyone I saw loved them too. they were a bit big and ran long, so I had to roll them under to not be too long on me. comfortable & fun.

Amazing pants that were so comfortable. I just wore them around the house, but they made me so happy. Really soft inside and the outside is a total pants party. I wish I could have worn them out, but corona quarantine...
First these are so comfortable. The lining is so soft. I got complimented on these all day. Fun and cute.

OMG! These pants are absolutely amazingly! They are so comfortable and soft on the inside. I could wear them everyday! I dressed them up with heels to go out, and vans for brunch and class. I received a ridiculous amount of compliments. I wanted to purchase them so bad, but they ran a bit big, so I would size down.

links_reviews_title: HUGE HUGE HUGE—Go down 2 or 3 sizes
links_reviews_text: I wanted to love these. I got a medium. A few months ago, I got Free People jeans in size 28 and they were SO VERY SMALL I was about six inches away from being able to button them. The next month, I got a different pair of Free People jeans in size 27 and they fit perfectly. So I thought a medium here would be a safe bet, but I should have gone XS, and that may still have been too large. May be best to just skip these.
I’m glad I followed the reviews and sized down. Way comfortable for a pair of sequin pants, but not super flattering. I liked it and was fun to try one time!
Heavier than expected but comfy and glamorous. Wish I had more occasions to wear them. Definitely oversized.
I should have ordered an XS, my normal FP soze, but S was all that was available and while a bit too loose, they still fit and I was able to style them. Sequins are not rough at all and dont snag.

I wear size 6 pants and need 24-25 inch inseam. Thought this would be long at 27 inch but the droopy style was ok. The sequins do scratch my ankles due to the droop. The size S fit me but could prob get away with XS.

links_reviews_title: Loved these, but too big and very warm
links_reviews_text: Do not wear these in the summer. They are lined and very warm. Too loose in the hips and waist.

links_reviews_title: Cute and surprisingly comfy but not flattering
links_reviews_text: This is cute but you won't look good in photos with it. It is cozier than it looks, which was a pleasant surprise, but it looks baggy. Perhaps I just can't pull it off.
Wore these to Disneyland. Fun and comfy - the inside is a comfortable cotton!

links_reviews_title: Cute but made me look bigger
links_reviews_text: I love how cute these are, but I’m curvy and this just made me look bigger. Very comfy though!

These pants are SO cute! I got so many compliments on them, and they are SUPER comfortable to boot, like silk PJs - I love that you can dress them up or down. They run SUPER big, though, be forewarned: I'm 5' 4" 120 and usually wear a 25/26, and I was drowning in the S - I had to roll the waistband to make them work. Had I ordered the XS to start with, I definitely would have bought them.

links_reviews_title: Fun but a little too large
links_reviews_text: Super enjoyed these pants and got a lot of compliments, they were a little large and long for me so it was harder to wear than I expected.
I rented these for a stay at home NYE night, and they were just massive (and not in a cute way). I would size down maybe 2 sizes.

links_reviews_title: These are solid gold, baby! Solid rose gold!
links_reviews_text: Wore these to a few winter parties and everyone everywhere loved them! I loved that it looked like I put effort into my look, but really I was wearing fancy sweatpants. I do think these would have fit better had they been a tad smaller in the waist, but again, they're glorified sweatpants, so I didn't care. I also think these would have fit better if I was an inch or a few inches taller, but again, didn't overly matter. The fit reasons are why I'm not purchasing this item; otherwise, solid gold, baby! Solid rose gold!
Beautiful sequins/color and would have been so fun to wear but I was swimming in the XL.

I wore these pants for New Years and they were a hit (so many compliments)! I kept casual wearing with a sweater and Adidas shoes and felt great. I did keep pulling the pants up because they were slightly larger than I liked. However, I think a small would have been too small. I would certainly rent again for a party.
Love these pants. So comfy, cozy and cute!! Really soft on the inside.

these pants run at least a full size big!! size down!! i had run into these in a store where they only had a large. the waist is cinchable so it wasn't a total loss, but the harem style made it look laughably huge on me. i took a chance and sized down to a small (typically i would go for a medium with a good butt/thighs) and i'm glad i did! they fit so much better!! no unsightly sagging or weird drooping anywhere. they look great with a spike heel, graphic tee and leather jacket. i MIGHT actually hang onto these... or at least, rent again!

links_reviews_title: Loved this top! Definitely true to size
links_reviews_text: I got a large because I was not sure how this would fit. I definitely should have gotten a medium. Fits true to size

If you don't like fussing with your clothes all night, be aware the ties on the sleeves come undone often. Only other issue is I didn't love the fit, because the torso is pretty shapeless, and cropped in an odd length for my height.
Wore this on NYE and loved it. It is a cropped length, so probably best with high waisted pants/skirt. The neck was a bit tight for me.
Got this to wear with jeans on NYE day and my teenage daughter confiscated it. It's a great party top. I'll be purchasing it for her to keep.
